intro: Henriquezia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco henriquezia, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
